direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are fundamental to object comparison and equality checks, with hashCode() often used in conjunction with equals() for hash-based collections.
Both methods use synchronization on the same lock object and delegate to the decorated queue, sharing similar control flow and exception handling.
Both methods interact with the same underlying queue resource, though they perform different operations (comparison vs. insertion).
Both methods interact with the same underlying queue resource, though they perform different operations (comparison vs. retrieval).
Both methods interact with the same underlying queue resource, though they perform different operations (comparison vs. removal).
